snippet.textDisplay: If I had to assume why they decided to focus primarily on balancing it around 3 players is for the sake of the revival system. If it was duos than it would be alot harder to rez your teammates as the boss would just focus the one remaining player who is trying to rez their teamates. While with 3 players, one teammate is rezing whos down and the other is distracting the boss/enemies from attacking and interrupting the one Rezing. And if it was 4 players the rez would be too easy because you can either have one person distracting while the other two rez one person, or two distract the boss and one doing the Rezing. Or one distracting and one rezzing two other teammates.
snippet.textOriginal: If I had to assume why they decided to focus primarily on balancing it around 3 players is for the sake of the revival system. If it was duos than it would be alot harder to rez your teammates as the boss would just focus the one remaining player who is trying to rez their teamates. While with 3 players, one teammate is rezing whos down and the other is distracting the boss/enemies from attacking and interrupting the one Rezing. And if it was 4 players the rez would be too easy because you can either have one person distracting while the other two rez one person, or two distract the boss and one doing the Rezing. Or one distracting and one rezzing two other teammates.

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly after deafeating a few bosses with friends, and some with randoms, comms aren't actually that important. They could help but the game doesn't really need them IMO. More variety is what I want, so many amazing bosses but you make me farm for thirty minutes only for the second biggest boss of the fight to be a tibia mariner that gives me three useless drops. Add more souls bosses, add more base game bosses to the runs, add more maps, add more customization and permanent upgrade systems than just the relics. Theres so much room for improvement but its still a great concept, the netcode is working for once, great idea, mediocre execution. If this wasn't elden ring gameplay this would be like a 4 but the combat elevates it to a place where it's already fun, just not fleshed out.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not a big fan of these complaints. I have problems with nightreign, but only having ping-based communication isn't one of them. You guys aren't wrong for wanting better communication. I'm in support of chat and crossplay etc.  But i think the much bigger issue is the execution of their gameplay loop. Beating things is much more of a numbers game than a hard-won victory. The battle royale storm doesn’t feel like a condusive way to speed up the pace of the game; I'm super disappointed that they couldn't think of anything better than a ring of fire designed to escalate tension in a rapidly-shrinking pvp environment. I think it's neat how they basically made an entire new game out of old assets, especially if it's not "mainline", but it feels like people are unwilling to criticize the gameplay. Everyone's just mad that there isn't modern communication methods in a game that stems from a company who explicitly goes out of their way to make communication clunky.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not a big fan of these complaints. I have problems with nightreign, but only having ping-based communication isn't one of them. You guys aren't wrong for wanting better communication. I'm in support of chat and crossplay etc.  But i think the much bigger issue is the execution of their gameplay loop. Beating things is much more of a numbers game than a hard-won victory. The battle royale storm doesn’t feel like a condusive way to speed up the pace of the game; I'm super disappointed that they couldn't think of anything better than a ring of fire designed to escalate tension in a rapidly-shrinking pvp environment. I think it's neat how they basically made an entire new game out of old assets, especially if it's not "mainline", but it feels like people are unwilling to criticize the gameplay. Everyone's just mad that there isn't modern communication methods in a game that stems from a company who explicitly goes out of their way to make communication clunky.

snippet.textDisplay: Im gonna be real the only problem is the bad players. If yk what youre doing and have played elden ring a fair bit communication really is not all that necessary the bosses are stuff you have most likely already lesrned to fight before. pin where youre going or what youre gonna do if youre lucky the other players will come to help with bigger bosses but even without the other players helping the game gives you so much tools to help yourself with. bad damage? Get pots, grease and exalted flesh anywhere. Bad weapons? You dont even need to kill a boss to get a weapon in most places, run in loot the chest, kill minor enemies then boom, you can weild whatever level 3 weapon u just picked up by leveling, you just gotta use your brain guys. And I play revenant, one of the worse classes in the game, constant agro on yourself and still having low health (rememberance quest helps alot by giving relics that buff the summons, BUT), the summons get destroyed by any aoe move, the worst scaling stats (only stats above B being mind and faith) when recluse has s faith and s intelligence and a better stamina pool(???). I understand that its supposed to be a support class but for a class that has no "prefered weapon" its abysmal. I wont say revenant is the worst tho that belongs to raider.

snippet.textDisplay: Okay look Nightreign does have some problems but because people hold fromsoftware in such high regard people aren’t giving the game any credit where it’s due and instead just nagging about all the bad things because the good stuff is just “expected”. I’m all for being constructive and asking for changes, but I hardly see anyone giving the game credit in the things it does right. The narrative will kill this game, not the game itself. At its core it’s fun and Fromsoftware are working hard to implement all the changes people are asking for.
snippet.textOriginal: Okay look Nightreign does have some problems but because people hold fromsoftware in such high regard people aren’t giving the game any credit where it’s due and instead just nagging about all the bad things because the good stuff is just “expected”. I’m all for being constructive and asking for changes, but I hardly see anyone giving the game credit in the things it does right. The narrative will kill this game, not the game itself. At its core it’s fun and Fromsoftware are working hard to implement all the changes people are asking for.

snippet.textDisplay: I also have a minor complaint about the single player. Since all of the enemies operate as if they're fighting 3 people at a time, they tend to either non stop attack allowing for no attacking on your end or they run away once it's finally your turn to attack. It's work aroundable and it doesn't really make the game bad but if they could find a way to tweak the single player experience a little bit without sacrificing the multiplayer aspect that'd be awesome. I prefer the 3 player pve but sometimes all of my friends are on already in 3 person groups so im by myself and id like to enjoy the game without dealing with janky AI that thinks im 3 people.

snippet.textDisplay:
Duos are hard to do if a team member gets knocked out since no one can distract the boss while the other member revives them. Though it would be nice to have it as an option regardless.

I've beaten all the nightlords excluding the last one. Trust me, no in-game chat is not as much of an issue as you would think. Using the map, markers, and movement, you can communicate the important stuff with most players ( from my experience, at least ).

No crossplay is a real issue with the game.

snippet.textDisplay:
The only part of this I actually agree with is the cross play. The rest feels pretty minor. At least with randoms, people tend to stick together and follow pings so I haven't felt a need to have a chat. Maybe a quick message thing with preset options could help occasionally, though if playing with friends I'd just use discord. As for duos, not every game is intended to be played that way and I think that's fine. It's a co-op game that is advertised for 3 players, though I have played with one person before when someone rage quit and.... It felt fine to me. We died to a challenging boss but that happens a lot anyway.

Though all that said, I can still see the points made as valid. Options are nice and sometimes it would be helpful to talk to randoms. It just may not be that important to me, I recognize it is to others

snippet.textDisplay:
I feel like people are becoming too dependent on Crossplay now.

Don't believe the companies, while the system *may* have been created for unifying playerbases, it's primary goal was always to make them money. COD, Apex and Fortnite use it to hide their egregious matchmaking algorithms behind a shield of PC players that on average have more time, skill and better hardware. 

All those games got caught having the matchmaking system be influenced by microtransactions, where those who pay, get easier lobbies. A COD console spender won't run into PC sweats, Fortnite players would have more "bots" in their next games.

snippet.textDisplay: I disagree with everything but the cross-play critique. Souls games have never had GC before, the community is long used to talking thru emotes and body language. It also provokes players to have some familiarity with all the classes so they know what their teammates might need, and eliminates the possibility of toxic chat (which lets admit can be a problem in souls likes, and I am saying this as a long time fan whos played and beaten most of the games). Also having a team of three is peefect imo, and rebalancing for duos or singles would create all the same problems having difficulty sliders in souls games would create, and ita my understanding that none of us want that. Trios are also perfect because anyone who's played these games before should be used to trios when taking on challenges, as every souls game before it that allows summons only allowed up to 2, creating a trio at max. Cross play should be implimented, but otherwise these other changes would just bring the experience down imo
snippet.textOriginal: I disagree with everything but the cross-play critique. Souls games have never had GC before, the community is long used to talking thru emotes and body language. It also provokes players to have some familiarity with all the classes so they know what their teammates might need, and eliminates the possibility of toxic chat (which lets admit can be a problem in souls likes, and I am saying this as a long time fan whos played and beaten most of the games). Also having a team of three is peefect imo, and rebalancing for duos or singles would create all the same problems having difficulty sliders in souls games would create, and ita my understanding that none of us want that. Trios are also perfect because anyone who's played these games before should be used to trios when taking on challenges, as every souls game before it that allows summons only allowed up to 2, creating a trio at max. Cross play should be implimented, but otherwise these other changes would just bring the experience down imo

snippet.textDisplay:
BUGS!! 

Your random teammate keeps dying and eventually ragequits mid boss fight? The entire server drops. 40 minute run down the drain due to a bug.

Gaping Dragon 2nd phase causes MASSIVE frame drops : I have a 4080 and went to 5FPS for ~3 seconds and before I could react I was already dead. Full flasks and everything just team wiped due to a bug. 

Another 40 minute run down the drain due to game code.

For that and the reasons you mentioned : I'd say its a 5 or 6 out of 10. Pretty disappointing. Has potential but needs a lot of work.

snippet.textDisplay:
Crossplay means PC cheaters get to mess up everyone's experience. Hard pass.
In game chat is also NOT necessary. No one wants to listen to a ranting 9yo because he can't be revived for the 10th time during a boss fight.
Duos should NOT be done because the game was designed around a 3 player experience. Giving duos an ok means that the pool of available games to join will be substantially reduced because:
A- an established duo won't be willing to take the difficulty increase to take in a random 3rd party member
B- normal players will have a lesser chance of finding a match.

People should stop with their complain and fix compulsion. The game is fine and i trust FromSoft to keep refining it further with THEIR view, which brought them to success. Not the newly arrived rage merchant audience that just can't stand that the game isn't their button mashing, mic yelling, adrenaline rush. Go away please...

What's funny is to see how good is Fromsoft is when it comes to create uniquely incredible and demanding solo experiences in original worlds.
And then they suck at making even the most required thing in multiplayer (hitboxes and and hitreg in pvp for example) 

Here they made a multiplayer game meant to be replayed manytimes but with a ridiculously thin gameplay loop variation and the most basic multiplayer things are not there 😂

Modders needed to do their job for Elden Ring multiplayer now they will have to do it again 😂

snippet.textDisplay:
edit: okay they are adding a dual campaign system guess i was wrong about one of them not afraid to admit when im wrong about something

to be honest i think this is one of the times your wrong, having it become like every other multiplayer game would kind of break from the immersion of the world, your free to just use discord to communicate, but as torterous as it is to work with strangers, ive had rounds where i just meet people who are insane and we never speak a single word but we both know were locking in

as for crossplay as cool as that would be, ps4 and xbox players would have to deal with hackers, pc players deal with hackers constantly and it can be extremely irritating dark souls 3 for the pc got hacked and everyones accounts were at risk if you logged online

and as for dual players, i dont think that would be balanced in a game like this, you would need to rewrite a lot of the game and change a ton just to make it fit

the only part it needs fixing is for singleplayer, that should take priority they area already making steps towards fixing it and making it more fair, what i would change about that is to simply tone down enemy damage a little bit, having multiple enemies attacking you at once tends to kill your run very fast and just makes you dance around aimlessly wasting your time, they need to make those senarios more liveable so you can speed past them

this is probably one of your most iffy takes ive seen, sorry but someones gonna point out to you, as someone whos been playing dark souls for quite a few years now these changes are not necessary or at least if there are to be changes they would not be in such a simplistic way, game balance is hard if you make your game too easy then a from game loses what makes it so good, the challenge otherwise its gets dull

snippet.textDisplay: 7/10 is so high... I'd say 5 at best. It's average with very little new and innovative things. The map feels the same despite the biome changes ans after enough runs, you've basically seem everything there is. The trailer really baited making us think they were bringing back tons of old bosses from previous games but we barely got any of them. Every run basically feels more or less similar. Find good weapon type for your class, roll through and grab your flasks and make quick choices deciding what is worth spending time on and repeat. I will say the single player experience feels really rough though with multiple enemies you'd think they would remove to make it a little more friendly or more time since doing anything solo takes a bit longer than with a group. The patch next week helps alleviate things for solo players but still.

snippet.textDisplay: There are definitely features that need to be added and reworked, duos, better communication abilities, and fixing the jump and climb mechanics are just a few. That said I am having a lot of fun with the game and think that the combination of concepts play together VERY well. Fromsoft is new to multiplayer focused games (for the most part) so I think given time these changes will be made, they have a good track record as far as games go and I have faith they’ll see what needs to be fixed and make the fixes.

snippet.textDisplay:
1. Lack of crossplay is annoying, but it doesn't impede matchmaking whatsoever. You can still find and play matches even if the playerbase is divided just because Fromsoft games have such a large audience.

2. No ingame chat is a good thing. You should really just be able to communicate using the in game systems, and chat has a way of making many games worse through toxicity. Honestly communication through action is what makes this game very fun. You are hoping that another person sees what you wish, and when they do or when you notice something your teammates want you to see; There is an invisible connection that would be made direct and far less magical if the communication was just via words.

3. Duos not being in the game was annoying at first, but playing with one random and one friend is actually really fun, and can fully spice up the experience. I understand the want to just solo with a friend, but until Duos gets added Trios with a random is still just as good if not better. Also, a game like Nightreign isn't designed for duos. The revival, combat, and difficulty all require team-based thinking and an amount of players so that if one person goes down: not half of the team does. Trios is kind of necessary for a proper execution of a game like this, and although Duos would be nice, it would mostly just be there to flesh out the game, and actually wouldn't play very good.
snippet.textOriginal:
1. Lack of crossplay is annoying, but it doesn't impede matchmaking whatsoever. You can still find and play matches even if the playerbase is divided just because Fromsoft games have such a large audience.

2. No ingame chat is a good thing. You should really just be able to communicate using the in game systems, and chat has a way of making many games worse through toxicity. Honestly communication through action is what makes this game very fun. You are hoping that another person sees what you wish, and when they do or when you notice something your teammates want you to see; There is an invisible connection that would be made direct and far less magical if the communication was just via words.

3. Duos not being in the game was annoying at first, but playing with one random and one friend is actually really fun, and can fully spice up the experience. I understand the want to just solo with a friend, but until Duos gets added Trios with a random is still just as good if not better. Also, a game like Nightreign isn't designed for duos. The revival, combat, and difficulty all require team-based thinking and an amount of players so that if one person goes down: not half of the team does. Trios is kind of necessary for a proper execution of a game like this, and although Duos would be nice, it would mostly just be there to flesh out the game, and actually wouldn't play very good.

snippet.textDisplay: Dude, bit of a boomer take but can we all just stop for a second and appreciate that crossplay has finally become an EXPECTED staple in the gaming industry? Like it wasn’t but a few years ago where the concept of being able to play a game with someone on different hardware was an utter pipe dream, and now it feels like it’s everywhere in some form or another. It’s really nice to see that you can almost certainly play games with a friend now even if they’re on a different system.
snippet.textOriginal: Dude, bit of a boomer take but can we all just stop for a second and appreciate that crossplay has finally become an EXPECTED staple in the gaming industry? Like it wasn’t but a few years ago where the concept of being able to play a game with someone on different hardware was an utter pipe dream, and now it feels like it’s everywhere in some form or another. It’s really nice to see that you can almost certainly play games with a friend now even if they’re on a different system.

snippet.textDisplay:
"Its better that there isnt an in-game chat."

The mute button exists. 

Enemies coming up in Warzone or even Apex Legends is no different than fighting the enemies and doing rotations in NightReign.
Main difference is PvP while the other is PvE. 
Either in both scenarios you have to communicate for a better chance to win.
Communication is the key. Pinging only helps so much.

snippet.textDisplay:
I have my trio, and in PS5 you can open a voice chat and done, so none of these are my problems. 
However I have another problem. Yes I have my trio, we're good and always play together, but the thing is that FromSoftware has always been really bad at making multiplayer actually work. Nightreign, just like Ds3, Elden Ring and Bloodborne (those are the ones I tried online, the rest I played all but by myself), has me and my buddies trying to join the group for several minutes, or worse like yesterday, we tried to connect for over an hour, constantly rebooting the game and trying different WiFis, it was awful. Fortunately once you connect you can play for hours, but if your connection is slightly restriced, like Nat 2, or Nat3 which basically makes it impossible, you're gonna suffer. I have Nat 2 which hurts, but I blame FromSoftware since no other game gives me trouble, we've played Nioh 1 and 2, The Last of Us online, Hunt Showdown, PayDay, Monster Hunter World Rise and Wilds, and many others, and yeah sometimes it takes a while to join but From games have always been a headache.
I guess this might be because they're on an experimental phase, with Nightreign and Duskbloods, which explains why online features are bad and, if I'm honest, I believe that if they're trying so hard to make multiplayer games it only means they intend to improve in this sense, this can only be a good thing since maybe through trial and error they finally start making top tier games with decent online features. 

Also I know I said nome of the problems from this short concerns me but now I remember, duos. Yes, I have my team, but sometimes one can't play so we have to deal with the worst randoms in history. Sometimes we get a nice dude, but that's not usually the case.
snippet.textOriginal:
I have my trio, and in PS5 you can open a voice chat and done, so none of these are my problems. 
However I have another problem. Yes I have my trio, we're good and always play together, but the thing is that FromSoftware has always been really bad at making multiplayer actually work. Nightreign, just like Ds3, Elden Ring and Bloodborne (those are the ones I tried online, the rest I played all but by myself), has me and my buddies trying to join the group for several minutes, or worse like yesterday, we tried to connect for over an hour, constantly rebooting the game and trying different WiFis, it was awful. Fortunately once you connect you can play for hours, but if your connection is slightly restriced, like Nat 2, or Nat3 which basically makes it impossible, you're gonna suffer. I have Nat 2 which hurts, but I blame FromSoftware since no other game gives me trouble, we've played Nioh 1 and 2, The Last of Us online, Hunt Showdown, PayDay, Monster Hunter World Rise and Wilds, and many others, and yeah sometimes it takes a while to join but From games have always been a headache.
I guess this might be because they're on an experimental phase, with Nightreign and Duskbloods, which explains why online features are bad and, if I'm honest, I believe that if they're trying so hard to make multiplayer games it only means they intend to improve in this sense, this can only be a good thing since maybe through trial and error they finally start making top tier games with decent online features. 

Also I know I said nome of the problems from this short concerns me but now I remember, duos. Yes, I have my team, but sometimes one can't play so we have to deal with the worst randoms in history. Sometimes we get a nice dude, but that's not usually the case.

snippet.textDisplay: Tbh nightreign isnt a 7/10 even if it has those features for me. I moreso agree with charlies (penguinz0) points about how the balancing feels bad, the weapons are hardly any different than the ones already in elden ring, and the gameplay just feels kinda stale after a while. The co-op focus is cool, but for me it just doesn't make sense to play nightreign over elden ring when its fundamentally the same except with roguelike mechanics that dont make it any more fun.
snippet.textOriginal: Tbh nightreign isnt a 7/10 even if it has those features for me. I moreso agree with charlies (penguinz0) points about how the balancing feels bad, the weapons are hardly any different than the ones already in elden ring, and the gameplay just feels kinda stale after a while. snippet.textDisplay: These complaints are so menial. The ping system is more than enough in regards to actually relaying info. As someone whos been in solo queues and cleared almost all the bosses, thats all you need. Duos are fine but the game is balanced around 3 specifically due to the rez system. Even with downscaled stats duos will just not be viable for a majority of players because of how it works. Rezzing someone with 3 stacks while the boss is on you 24/7 is just near impossible without stuff like your ultimate art. Cross play also may have been out for 6 years but not a lot of games support it so to expect it to be there is just pointless. These complaints are just stupid and they would be nice to have but this does not retract from the overall multiplayer experience outside of duos, which I think would actively be bad for the game and people would hate it more.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm honestly tired of the mindset developers have now of releasing an unfinished product and taking the next 6 months after launch to finish it. They do this because the apologist crowd let's them. Just because it has Elden Ring in the name doesn't mean we have to automatically like it. This is an obvious proof of concept cash grab using a popular game's name. There's no build variety, every match feels exactly the same, the loot you find isnt meaningful, the list goes on. After the first 4-5 hours you've experienced everything the game has to offer, because the formula never changes. We need to stop acting like you can't criticize something just because your favorite developer made it.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm honestly tired of the mindset developers have now of releasing an unfinished product and taking the next 6 months after launch to finish it. They do this because the apologist crowd let's them. Just because it has Elden Ring in the name doesn't mean we have to automatically like it. This is an obvious proof of concept cash grab using a popular game's name. There's no build variety, every match feels exactly the same, the loot you find isnt meaningful, the list goes on. After the first 4-5 hours you've experienced everything the game has to offer, because the formula never changes. We need to stop acting like you can't criticize something just because your favorite developer made it.

I swear at this point Fromsoft does this intentionally when it leaves out features and refuses to fix bugs or implants multiplayer poorly.
Dark Souls 1  the small invisible wall on the main pathway in the Great Hollow. Beat an endgame DLC boss to unlock arena battles
Dark Souls 2 give you in game items to fix multiplayer instead of a menu option 
Dark Souls 3 beat an endgame DLC boss to unlock arena battles DS1 did the same thing.
Elden Ring Unclear area bosses that disable co op and need to install a mod if you want proper coop if you're lucky enough to be on pc just because Fromsoft don't want it in the game. I have gripes with the campaign as well like the Mass Effect like endings but whatever.

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly (I have yet to get a copy) the game is pretty nice, the art, the combat, the music everything. They have mentioned that 2-Player Multiplayer has been over looked (PC got a mod already to right the issue) and they do believe it would make for a good post launch patch though timeline has yet to be disclosed. So far heard nothing on in-game Communications being added, another thing though they don't have cross-platform (none of their games everdid and I doubt they will ever have it since literally every title they have made with Limited Multiplayer function has been limited to the same function) but they do have Cross-Gen play, essentially Xbox One can play with Xbox X/S and PS4 can play with PS5. Nintendo has no plans on being compatible for it as far as I can tell. Probably because Duskbloods will be the only Fromsoft title Nintendo gets for awhile.
snippet.textOriginal: Honestly (I have yet to get a copy) the game is pretty nice, the art, the combat, the music everything. They have mentioned that 2-Player Multiplayer has been over looked (PC got a mod already to right the issue) and they do believe it would make for a good post launch patch though timeline has yet to be disclosed. So far heard nothing on in-game Communications being added, another thing though they don't have cross-platform (none of their games everdid and I doubt they will ever have it since literally every title they have made with Limited Multiplayer function has been limited to the same function) but they do have Cross-Gen play, essentially Xbox One can play with Xbox X/S and PS4 can play with PS5. Nintendo has no plans on being compatible for it as far as I can tell. Probably because Duskbloods will be the only Fromsoft title Nintendo gets for awhile.

snippet.textDisplay:
I really like this new concept. But i agree, there are some flaws to the game i wish FromSoftware would have done better. 
A: as you said, no option for 2 player squads.
B: lack of guidance (although i know FS never really guides players) e.g: No Timer for the Zone (ahh let's explore this cave - bam, dead), No Map Legend etc.. like how tf should a new player now where to upgrade his weapons for the Boss fight? Or how to use the stonesword Keys?
C: Lack of Communication with random players. Like at least include some shortcut text messages to signal something for the Team.

I really hope they fix these topics in coming updates, other than that i really enjoy the game.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Pc crossplay is a stupid idea. Console crossplay only.

Tbh i dont get most of these complaints. I think most people dont like it for their own reasons they cant articulate so they regurgitate this bs. Game chat is fair enough of a complaint but overblown, and trios is not awkward at all, wtf? Tank, healer, dps is the standard with room for other combinations. This is a community multiplayer game with mmo dna in it. Being an anti social loser too afraid to even play with random people would kill the random queue so quick like in many other games. Btw if people are scared to socialize now imagine with VC.

Also thinking balance is just a numbers gane is such a brain dead take. Go play solo and tell me its just a numbers change. No its a whole change in attacks and mechanics.  In solo mode you wont even get attacked by more than 1 boss at a time in duo boss fights. My point being, no they cant just "scale it down for duos" actually stupid af.

snippet.textDisplay: I kind of have to agree, the option to run solo, duo, or trio, and in game party chat would go a long way. Beyond that, it's incredibly fun. The unique abilities of the individual characters are interesting and bring a lot of dynamic options to combat. The additional movement mechanics add a lot to traversal as well. At the same time... no VC keeps with the Souls vibe just fine anyway, we managed to clear touch bosses with little more than loosely structured co-op since the onset of Demon's Souls, so, honestly, this hasn't been that bad. Each character has their own strengths, so as long as your playing to your strengths, and paying attention when the squishy mage character gets oneshotted, your probably golden.
snippet.textOriginal: I kind of have to agree, the option to run solo, duo, or trio, and in game party chat would go a long way. Beyond that, it's incredibly fun. The unique abilities of the individual characters are interesting and bring a lot of dynamic options to combat. The additional movement mechanics add a lot to traversal as well. At the same time... no VC keeps with the Souls vibe just fine anyway, we managed to clear touch bosses with little more than loosely structured co-op since the onset of Demon's Souls, so, honestly, this hasn't been that bad. Each character has their own strengths, so as long as your playing to your strengths, and paying attention when the squishy mage character gets oneshotted, your probably golden.

snippet.textDisplay: After playing for a while, I've realized why balancing for 2 players would be difficult. It's not just the enemy damage numbers, enemy density, and player power scaling/rune acquisition that would need to be changed. The revival mechanism itself would need to possibly see a complete revision. Right now, as it stands, you revive a player by dealing damage to them. Both the players and the enemies in the game move at a much more increased speed overall, and with 3 players, the typical solution is for one player to draw aggro while the other assists their comrade. In a duo match, if one player goes down, the second player is now tasked with both avoiding the current enemy/enemies and finding an opportunity to revive the other player. This already happens in trio sessions when two teammates go down, and it's one of the hardest situations to recover from. Imagine if that was happening EVERY time one of the two players went down. To balance this, the developers would possibly have to change the revive system, the overall enemy aggression level, the damage that enemies can deal to a given player, the speed at which a teammate can be revived, and a number of other values that would make this comment way too long. I am not saying this can't be done, but we might need to look to a complete overhaul of game mechanics in order to make duo matches more viable.
snippet.textOriginal: After playing for a while, I've realized why balancing for 2 players would be difficult. It's not just the enemy damage numbers, enemy density, and player power scaling/rune acquisition that would need to be changed. The revival mechanism itself would need to possibly see a complete revision. Right now, as it stands, you revive a player by dealing damage to them. Both the players and the enemies in the game move at a much more increased speed overall, and with 3 players, the typical solution is for one player to draw aggro while the other assists their comrade. In a duo match, if one player goes down, the second player is now tasked with both avoiding the current enemy/enemies and finding an opportunity to revive the other player. This already happens in trio sessions when two teammates go down, and it's one of the hardest situations to recover from. Imagine if that was happening EVERY time one of the two players went down. To balance this, the developers would possibly have to change the revive system, the overall enemy aggression level, the damage that enemies can deal to a given player, the speed at which a teammate can be revived, and a number of other values that would make this comment way too long. I am not saying this can't be done, but we might need to look to a complete overhaul of game mechanics in order to make duo matches more viable.

I think if they add these in, in a patch in the next few months then the game could go on to win GOTY

snippet.textDisplay:
My honest opinion? This game would slap and make headlines if they fixed everything. i think this is what they should do in order.

- Crossplay
- Duo mode with proper scaling (and fix solo scaling)
- Ingame voice/text chat
- More Nightlords. I know Miyazaki has ideas cookin’.
- New maps. Right now, all we have is a modified Limgrave. They could do the same with Caelid, even Altus Plateau, or Consecrated Snowfield… Liurnia too, maybe.

snippet.textDisplay:
Nightreig is clearly the "small game after a really big one" game they usually do. 

Its meant to give devs some breathing room after massive proyects like Elden ring and its dlc and allow them to experiment with new ideas. Like they did with Sekiro, which allowed them to test if a more straightforward narrative could translate well.

This looks like them actually putting some effort in the mp part of their games. And although crossplay should be enabled by default, i think chat and other stuff are not necessary since mp in souls games have always been about emotes and jumping

Quit whining. It’s a fun game and it’s meant to be co-op. They balanced it for three players because they have a bunch of unique character builds that have active and passive skills to help each other. Thats the point of the game.

They have in game mechanics to communicate with each other like markers and pings which work fine. No need to hear 13 year olds over voice chat who never shut up. If you want You can still setup voice chat with apps like discord, slack and teams etc

Enjoy!

snippet.textDisplay:
this game isnt the best launch game ever but it honestly has the best potential of any souls game if they add a duo mode (maybe even a 4 player for those bigger groups)
balance each mode for the player capacity ie solo not being overwhelming in some fights. adding coms either vc or a chat or both sure itll seep in toxicity but itll help those who really wanna work with their team.

but onto the other benefits of the game.
they can occasionally drop new weapons and bosses without needing alot to do so if they pull them from the other games, and sure a new map would be time consuming to make but it would allow for more unique runs every time you get into the game. but as long as they even just follow the multiplayer and communication issue the game will already prob shoot to a 9/10 easily

snippet.textDisplay: Honestly the game is really underwhelming. It's not fun at all if you're not playing with friends and even if you are, the bosses they've chosen to include in Nightreign are some of the worst ones from base ER. I was looking forward to fighting some of Fromsofts best/coolest bosses and yet there's no Gael, Midir, Artorias, Soul of Cinder etc, yet they decided to bring back Centipede Demon and Gaping Dragon. It's a very weird game that would likely be getting slandered heavily if not for the "Elden Ring" attached to it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Probably an unpopular opinion; but I don't want an in-game chat. FromSoftwares gesture system has always felt unique to me, and lets players be creative to make their own in-game language. There is also a pretty decent ping-system in the game already, for showing items, places and enemies. I'm a little shocked over the amount of criticism I see for this game. It runs smooth, it's challenging but fun, the classes are really unique, all with different rememberance-quests, etc.
I also realize that I'm a veteran FromSoftware fanboy, so it may be a little difficult for me to see some of the apperant  issues. 

Tl,dr: I feel like Nightreign does way more good then bad. I really enjoy the game so far, and have no doubt FromSoftware will patch in "necessary" changes. But I personally don't want an in-game chat, or god forbid a voice chat.
snippet.textOriginal:

I also realize that I'm a veteran FromSoftware fanboy, so it may be a little difficult for me to see some of the apperant  issues.

snippet.textDisplay:
honestly its more like a 4/10 currently 
cuz if u look at the rouge like aspect of the game it feels just like a very bad randomizer mod from 10 years ago not fully grasping the build potential that comes with a rouge like especially considering the newer randomizer mods and newer rouge likes and their mechanics to give a sense of direction while getting stronger.
and another thing is it just feels like u r playing a bad randomizer mod, I mean I see the direction with planning ur route on the map with the different locations but it is hard to plan more than 2 priority locations in a run given the pace of the game and the enemy scaling and even then the loot might not be helpful at all.
for one a mini map would make that a lot easier
for two 
most players dont even know wtf they r doing in their runs cuz the only time u see accurate stats is on the training grounds and even then I cant even see the stats on ur character.
this game feels like they needed money cuz they recycled A LOT of stuff in there and slapped together some cool sounding concepts to lure people without informing themselves about them, example 1. the half assed rougelike mechanics.
I mean look at how far modern rougelikes have come.
example 2. the map and the round progression wich kinda feels like a battleroyale , which is a cool concept but again no mini map
random starting point and therefore no route planning even if u studied the map for extended amounts of time.
as a huge from soft fan I am disappointed 
I see the small things that got love like the Executioner getting full sekiro combat or the recluse combo magic but then I see these big problems and i think that is below fromsofts standard even with trying out new type of games it feels like a money grab and not like somebody took the concept serious

snippet.textDisplay:
A few more things that could use tweaking (based off of my time in the game so far) are:
1. Climbing can be INSANELY janky, I would honestly replace the climbing things on walls with a one button animation that gets you to the top.
2. The bars when you are downed fill back up WAY too fast. I would reccomend making it so either once a player goes down a bar (for example from 3 to 2) then it does not fill back up, or takes more than ~2 seconds before it immediately fills back up. Another alternative would be to make attacks do more revive damage.
3. I have played a decent amount of most classes, and I would say that Guardian needs something to make it better. Executor is a better tank because of parrying, Guardians just die through their shield. Raider gets an S in strength and an A in vigor, but Guardian gets a B strength? It tanks worse than Executor, it does no damage, and its abilities do not do any damage either. In a game like nightreign dodging is just better, because not taking damage means you live longer, but Guardian's entire thing is being a tank, yet you still fold into an origami crane like the rest of the classes, while doing lackluster damage. On top of that, your rememberance relic is terrible compared to all other classes. I will still play the birdman, but unless I am doing something wrong, he does everything worse than every other class.
Please, if there are bird mains out there that can give me tips if I'm just wrong I would appreciate it.
snippet.textOriginal:
A few more things that could use tweaking (based off of my time in the game so far) are:
1. Climbing can be INSANELY janky, I would honestly replace the climbing things on walls with a one button animation that gets you to the top.
2. The bars when you are downed fill back up WAY too fast. I would reccomend making it so either once a player goes down a bar (for example from 3 to 2) then it does not fill back up, or takes more than ~2 seconds before it immediately fills back up. Another alternative would be to make attacks do more revive damage.
3. I have played a decent amount of most classes, and I would say that Guardian needs something to make it better. Executor is a better tank because of parrying, Guardians just die through their shield. Raider gets an S in strength and an A in vigor, but Guardian gets a B strength? It tanks worse than Executor, it does no damage, and its abilities do not do any damage either. In a game like nightreign dodging is just better, because not taking damage means you live longer, but Guardian's entire thing is being a tank, yet you still fold into an origami crane like the rest of the classes, while doing lackluster damage. On top of that, your rememberance relic is terrible compared to all other classes. I will still play the birdman, but unless I am doing something wrong, he does everything worse than every other class.
Please, if there are bird mains out there that can give me tips if I'm just wrong I would appreciate it.

snippet.textDisplay: I may be a bit too harsh but I think a 7/10 might be a bit too high. I’m the biggest from software glazer, I been playin these games since I was eight years old. But there r other issues with the game. For example: lack of randomness with enemies and bosses, no duos, no in game chat, lack of creativity. These r all I could think of off the top my head. Not a bad game, but with the lack of creativity and how much potential this game has I can’t go higher than a 5/10. If they don’t make these changes soon this game is gonna die within the next two weeks

snippet.textDisplay: I can excuse the lack of crossplay because... this is their first time 100% diving into multiplayer. Yeah, some dude on Nexus could make a Seamless Co-op mod that allowd crossplay in different consoles and all, but this has never been From's Forte. It's always been an experiment that became part of the identity of Souls, even when admittedly neglected.
snippet.textOriginal: I can excuse the lack of crossplay because... this is their first time 100% diving into multiplayer. Yeah, some dude on Nexus could make a Seamless Co-op mod that allowd crossplay in different consoles and all, but this has never been From's Forte. It's always been an experiment that became part of the identity of Souls, even when admittedly neglected.

snippet.textDisplay:
I honestly disagree about most of these being that big of issues. Cross play is only necessary to have if the game has a small player base. Any group size is an awkward number of you choose for it to be. Voice chat would be nice to have but at the same time probably half the time i play competitive shooters for example nobody talks anyways. If you want voice chat so badly it takes like 3 clicks to join a discord server to look for groups. 

Would i like to see duos and voice chat? 100% that'd be great. Are they necessary? No.

I'm all for having voices of the community be heard and issues be addressed but the way most people are acting in regards to the issues make themselves sound like privileged whiny babies nitpicking at anything they possibly can.

snippet.textDisplay: Always found it weird how nightreign has the identity of being a 3 person experience. Bosses, the map, the amount of enemies spawns and even the amount of loot that spawns is designed for the 3 person dynamic. Yet people still complain the game isn’t built to accommodate them. It’s a $40 dollar game (still overpriced compared to everything Elden ring offered), it’s a souls game so there’s little accommodating for the most part and was marketed as a 3 person game. So why is there such violent demand for duos

snippet.textDisplay:
I don’t see how it could be a 10/10. 

90% of the game you’ve already played. It’s called Elden Ring. 

Nightreign is nothing more than a cash-grab to appease the stockholders. 

As with Dark Souls 2 and its many dlcs. 

That doesn’t mean I don’t think Nightreign has to suck. Just as DS2 doesn’t suck. 
But we shouldn’t pretend like this release is more than a quick buck while Elden Ring remains hot. 

Fromsoft is a company, my fellow fans. And what do companies care for more than all else?

snippet.textDisplay: It's very clear they built the full game straight out of the elden ring framework, and elden ring does not have crossplay either. They definitely made this game in two years or less and I would imagine changing the framework for crossplay to function properly wasn't in the time constraints for development. Voice chat definitely would be cool, but it would also introduce a level of toxicity they clearly don't want in the game and it's also another update to the framework they would have to do since it wasn't a thing in Elden Ring either. All of the "flaws" the game has currently are readily explained by how quickly they made it and the limitations Elden Ring as it's foundation created for it without pushing development time out over multiple years.
snippet.textOriginal: It's very clear they built the full game straight out of the elden ring framework, and elden ring does not have crossplay either. They definitely made this game in two years or less and I would imagine changing the framework for crossplay to function properly wasn't in the time constraints for development. Voice chat definitely would be cool, but it would also introduce a level of toxicity they clearly don't want in the game and it's also another update to the framework they would have to do since it wasn't a thing in Elden Ring either. All of the "flaws" the game has currently are readily explained by how quickly they made it and the limitations Elden Ring as it's foundation created for it without pushing development time out over multiple years.

snippet.textDisplay:
They need comms, solo's, duo's, and squads, and of course cross play. 

Communication just needs more quick info messages, a chat to put them in along with the ability to type like normal, and a mic system/voice chat of course is needed along with that (idk if it has all these features or just some/none)

For different squad up choices you can simply scale the gameplay back by damage and health values, or even bosses moving a bit slower or moving less if necessary but I think in this case they shouldn't touch that like a normal difficulty system might. Think Halo making enemies higher rank and thus different reactions in fights like more or less movement and faster trigger fingers, along with health and damage tweaks.

And then, of course, cross play is a must in 2025.

I'm not saying the game is bad for mot having it, at all. Unlike if a studio experienced in these things were to make a game missing them, in this case they can get a pass for the most part.
That said they SHOULD see if they can put out an update to add these key features post launch in response to community feedback! It would get them that much more points and favor for doing so. BG3 just did it themselves, so it's definitely in the realm of possibility and absolutely something they need to do, it just makes sense to have it.

snippet.textDisplay: Show me a single souls game from fromsoftware that had chat or voip. Most of them had multiplayer and only way of communication we had were gestures. In Nightregin we can place a mark on a map and other players can agree with our choice by supporting us by pressing R3-then our mark changes colour so another player knows where team is going. Game is too fast and there is no time to write (souls like are made for controllers). Also against voip in the game would be similar issue like for example in cod games. Also thanks for no crossplay, as a PC player I don’t want to play with someone who has fps drops due weak console hardware especially that game is on ps4 and Xbox series S as well.
snippet.textOriginal: Show me a single souls game from fromsoftware that had chat or voip. Most of them had multiplayer and only way of communication we had were gestures. snippet.textDisplay:
I want to give them the benefit of the doubt because they've put out bangers for years now, but at the same time, they had to have known these were problems. They've been using the same multiplayer system of password matchmaking with gestures as your only form of communication for over a decade now. Elden Ring's biggest mod being the Co-op mod should've been the kick they needed to implement modern multiplayer QoL improvements like in-game chats, private lobbies you can join from the menu instead of passwords people can guess, a censoring system that doesn't block the name "Nightreign" because of its first 3 letters, and crossplay. 

And then the duos problem is just a really bad oversight on their part. They thought to scale it down for solos and made the game for trios but didn't expect anyone to go for the middle ground?
snippet.textOriginal:
I want to give them the benefit of the doubt because they've put out bangers for years now, but at the same time, they had to have known these were problems. Elden Ring's biggest mod being the Co-op mod should've been the kick they needed to implement modern multiplayer QoL improvements like in-game chats, private lobbies you can join from the menu instead of passwords people can guess, a censoring system that doesn't block the name "Nightreign" because of its first 3 letters, and crossplay. 

And then the duos problem is just a really bad oversight on their part. They thought to scale it down for solos and made the game for trios but didn't expect anyone to go for the middle ground?

snippet.textDisplay:
1. Even if game needs a duo mode (comes from a person with a friend of my own), you still can just queue with a random because its fun in the end.

2. Even if this game is primarily is a multiplayer experience, its VERY much balanced in the solo. I was playing it in between my multiplayer runs and easily got to the day 3 and challenged boss in the end. (right now stuck on the bugs… I hate duo bosses.)

The game is great. Dont get me wrong it has its problems, like a bug where your screen turns completely black until you get into settings (somehow) and turn on full screen. I guess thats a problem of a window mode. But the game is solid and provides tons of fun. You just have to treat it not as the next Elden Ring or another soul-series. No, its an experimental rogue-like experience. With random weapons of your choice (because all weapons are viable, you can make a straight sword that outdamages legendary weapons) and traits, which are cool no matter what people say. Yes, game needs patches, which is why devs said that those are coming out. Same as duo and dlc that has will be available in 6 months.

snippet.textDisplay: Nightreign is one of those games that can be drastically improved by just adding “more.” More maps for specific bosses, more unique weapons, and ESPECIALLY more ways to improve your characters in between runs. The relic system is fine for what it is, but the improvements are minor and situational. While a big parts of rogue-likes is restarting over and over again, another big part is visible improvement and unlocking of new gear each run. I think that adding unlockable skills and ultimate arts would be a great way to have actual progression. Another really great improvement would be a rest period in between days 1 and 2, for a chance to manage your inventory and plan ahead.
snippet.textOriginal: Nightreign is one of those games that can be drastically improved by just adding “more.” More maps for specific bosses, more unique weapons, and ESPECIALLY more ways to improve your characters in between runs. The relic system is fine for what it is, but the improvements are minor and situational. While a big parts of rogue-likes is restarting over and over again, another big part is visible improvement and unlocking of new gear each run. I think that adding unlockable skills and ultimate arts would be a great way to have actual progression. Another really great improvement would be a rest period in between days 1 and 2, for a chance to manage your inventory and plan ahead.

snippet.textDisplay: Been a fromsoft fan for a long time and the one thing that always stood out was how they mapped out multiplayer mechanics in every one of their games that included it.  Bringing new players in was always “ok so how do we play together?”  “well first I need to go find this item in the second area of the game, go talk to this NPC, make sure I’m human, then make a portal through time and space that you ALSO need to interact with.  OH, and we gotta set a password so it works better.”
snippet.textOriginal: Been a fromsoft fan for a long time and the one thing that always stood out was how they mapped out multiplayer mechanics in every one of their games that included it.  Bringing new players in was always “ok so how do we play together?”  “well first I need to go find this item in the second area of the game, go talk to this NPC, make sure I’m human, then make a portal through time and space that you ALSO need to interact with. snippet.textDisplay:
Very well said. The only thing that I see them possibly not implementing is the duos because it would make their original vision of a three man group even more difficult because people would just do duos instead of waiting or looking for a third. 

Everything else is on point. No cross platform or voice chat is insane. It’s still really fun but feels incomplete because of those things
